info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 21 at 8:23PM CDT until April 23 at 6:13PM CDT by NWS St Louis MO
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Missouri...
Moreau River near Jefferson City.
...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Missouri...
Maries River near Westphalia.
River forecasts are based on observed precipitation and forecast precipitation for the next 24 hours.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Moreau River near Jefferson City.
* WHEN...Until Wednesday evening.
* IMPACTS...At 23.5 feet, Near this height, Walnut Acres Road near North Moreau Creek will likely need to be closed.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM CDT Monday the stage was 23.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:30 PM CDT Monday was 23.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 24.0 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
This product, along with additional weather and stream information, is available at https://water.noaa.gov/wfo/lsx

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY EVENING
